scan.name: Possible vulnerable Apache < 1.3.26
scan.description: Vulnerabilities in earlier versions of Apache.

scan.name: Open Proxy
scan.description: Open Proxy allows one to gain access to some pages protected by DNS lookups or IP limited access.
scan.fix: Turn off Proxy or restrict to specific addresses

scan.name: IIS ViewCode SiteServer Inspired
scan.description: Many of the sample files shipped with Microsoft Internet Information Server (IIS) and SiteServer can be remotely exploited to read arbitrary files on vulnerable servers.

scan.name: HTTP DELETE allowed
scan.description: The DELETE method requests that the origin server delete the resource identified by the Request-URI. This method MAY be overridden by human intervention (or other means) on the origin server.
scan.fix: Disable off DELETE in the options of the web server

scan.name: HTTP PUT allowed
scan.description: The PUT method can be used to allow people to upload content to a web server via the HTTP protocol directly. If it is misconfigured it can also allow anyone to upload any contact, or even over-write content and should be used with GREAT CAUTION.
scan.fix: Disable PUT for all directories in the web server, this may mean disabling WRITE permissions on the web server

scan.name: Infected CodeRed & VLUN /msadc/root.exe
scan.description: The "Code Red" worm is self-replicating malicious code that exploits a known vulnerability in Microsoft IIS servers

scan.name: Infected CodeRed & VLUN /scripts/root.exe
scan.description: The "Code Red" worm is self-replicating malicious code that exploits a known vulnerability in Microsoft IIS servers

scan.name: Infected with Nimda /readme.eml
scan.description: The Nimda worm has the potential to affect both user workstations (clients) running Windows 95, 98, ME, NT, or 2000 and servers running Windows NT and 2000.

scan.name: UniCode Exploit from /scripts..%c0%af..%c0%af
scan.description: IS 4.0 and 5.0 allows remote attackers to read documents outside of the web root, and possibly execute arbitrary commands, via malformed URLs that contain UNICODE encoded characters, aka the "Web Server Folder Traversal" vulnerability.

scan.name: Remote cmd exec (via SQL) AdvWorks sample files
IIS password brute iisadmpwd/aexp4b.htr
scan.description: can be used for brute force password attacks, or to identify valid users on the system, allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a malformed request, AND allows local users to bypass the "User cannot change password" policy for Windows NT
scan.fix: Remove IISADMPWD from the IIS Admin MMC

scan.name: FrontPage extention dvwssr.dll
scan.fix: Uninstall FP or delete the file

scan.name: Netscape DOS
scan.description: A vulnerability exists in iPlanet Web Server, Enterprise Edition and Netscape Enterprise Server in which a malformed Web Publisher command can crash the web server process. This vulnerability only affects Windows NT based servers.
scan.fix: Disable web publishing or filter out the bad content (see i-Planet)

scan.name: Site Server findserver w/LDAP anon user
Site Server driver w/LDAP anon user
Site Server DSN w/LDAP anon user
Site Server GroupManager w/LDAP anon user
Site Server UserManager w/LDAP anon user
Site Server dsmgr w/LDAP anon user
Site Server autoconfig w/LDAP anon user
Site Server formslogin w/LDAP anon user
Site Server Publishing Users w/LDAP anon user
JRUN WEB-INF Access
scan.fix: Follow the recommendations given in Allaire Security Bulletin ASB00-27, available at: http://www.allaire.com/security/
scan.description: A severe security flaw exists with Allaire's JRun 3.0 allowing an attacker to access WEB-INF directories on the JRun 3.0 server. The WEB-INF directory tree contains web application classes, pre-compiled JSP files, server side libraries, session information and files such as web.xml and webapp.properties.

scan.name: _vti_bin/fpcount.exe Buffer Overflow
scan.fix: Uninstall MSFP, delete /_vti_bin/fpcount.exe and/or remove virtual mapping for _vti_bin

scan.name: webhits.dll arbitrary file access
scan.description: Webhits.dll is part of the Microsoft Index Server package distributed with Windows NT 4.0 and 2000. A problem with the package could allow remote users to gain access to source code of ASP docuements.

scan.name: /_vti_bin/shtml.dll file access
scan.fix: Uninstall MSFP, delete /_vti_bin/shtml.dll and/or remove virtual mapping for _vti_bin

scan.name: fp30reg.dll Buffer Overflow
scan.fix: Uninstall MSFP, delete /_vti_bin/fp30reg.dll and/or remove virtual mapping for _vti_bin

scan.name: shtml XSS
scan.fix: Remove .shtml mapping, delete shtml.dll and patch

scan.name: WebDAV DoS on SEARCH
scan.description: It is possible to remotely restart all IIS related service using specially crafted request. It is also possible to force IIS to consume memory which it does not free. Possible Buffer Overflow
scan.send:
SEARCH / HTTP/1.1 Host: %HOST% Content-Type: text/xml Content-Length: 133
<?xml version="1.0"?> <g:searchrequest xmlns:g="DAV:"> <g:sql> Select "DAV:displayname" from scope() </g:sql> </g:searchrequest>

scan.name: WebDAV DoS on PROPFIND
scan.description: It is possible to remotely restart all IIS related service using specially crafted request. It is also possible to force IIS to consume memory which it does not free. Possible Buffer Overflow
scan.send:
PROPFIND / HTTP/1.1 Host: %HOST% Content-Type: text/xml Content-Length: 110
<?xml version="1.0"?> <a:propfind xmlns:a="DAV:"> <a:prop> <a:displayname:/> </a:prop> </a:propfind>

scan.name: Site Server 3 XSS _mem_bin
scan.fix: Uninstall SiteServer or Delete problem files

scan.name: Oracle Configuration
scan.description: These admin menus should only be accessable with username and password.

scan.name: .HTR Mapping
scan.expect: The requested file could not be found.
scan.description:
At least one remote vulnerability has been discovered for the .HTR filter. This is detailed in Microsoft Advisory MS02-018, and gives remote SYSTEM level access to the web server.
It is recommended that even if you have patched this vulnerability that you unmap the .HTR extension, and any other unused ISAPI extensions if they are not required for the operation of your site.
